meanings.definition: To incorrectly give a title or name to something.
meanings.sent1: She kept mistitling her classmates during the roll call.
meanings.sent2: The librarian was mistitling the books in the wrong sections.
meanings.sent3: The magician's mistitling of his tricks led to a hilarious mix-up on stage.
meanings.sent4: The chef mistitling the ingredients turned the soup into a surprising dish.
meanings.sent5: The detective's mistitling of the suspect made the case more challenging to solve.

meanings.definition: The act of misnaming or mislabeling something.
meanings.sent1: The mistitling of the exhibit confused the museum visitors.
meanings.sent2: His constant mistitling of the actors in the movie script caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mistitling of the toy mouse as real led to a funny chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The mistitling of the map locations made the treasure hunt more exciting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's mistitling of the students' names made the classroom atmosphere light-hearted.
